column1: # CASE: SAIGON-DONG NAI RIVER SYSTEM - Complete 4-Branch Model (Y-into-Y)

column2: relatively clean from Tri An reservoir

column1: #   - Soai Rap: Wide main outlet channel (lower RS
#   - Long Tau: Narrow winding channel through Can Gio mangroves (high RS=7.0)
#   - 2.0: Wide estuarine channel (Soai Rap - some tidal flats)
#   - 7.0: Mangrove-dominated channel (Long Tau - Can Gio core)
# 1. Dong Nai River: Tri An Dam (Node 1) to Confluence (Node 3)
# Length: 45 km from Tri An to Nha Be confluence area
# 2. Saigon River: Dau Tieng Reservoir (Node 2) to Confluence (Node 3)
# Length: 80 km from Dau Tieng through HCMC to Nha Be
# 3. Soai Rap: Confluence (Node 3) to Soai Rap Mouth (Node 4)
# Lower RS than Long Tau because it's a massive open channel
# 4. Long Tau: Confluence (Node 3) to Long Tau Mouth (Node 5)
# CRITICAL: Winding channel through Can Gio Mangrove Biosphere Reserve
# This is where the mangrove physics (RS=7.0

column3: with extensive tidal flats and mangrove forest

column1: # Length: 55 km through the mangrove system
# BiogeoParams: High benthic respiration (120 mmol C/m²/day)
